bitfield.description: The scheme of the register used. This indicates the PDR3.5 Method
Always read as 0
The function of the module being used
RTL Release Version The PDR release number of this IP
Major Release Number
Custom IP
Minor Release Number
Always read as 0
Always read as 0

Configuration of the local target state management mode. By definition, target can handle read/write transaction as long as it is out of IDLE state 0x0 : Force-idle mode: local target's idle state follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests unconditionally, i.e. regardless of the IP module's internal requirements. Backup mode, for debug only 0x1 : No-idle mode: local target never enters idle state. Backup mode, for debug only 0x2 : Smart-idle mode: local target's idle state eventually follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests, depending on the IP module's internal requirements. IP module shall not generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wakeup events 0x3 : Smart-idle wakeup-capable mode: local target's idle state eventually follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests, depending on the IP module's internal requirements. IP module may generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wakeup events when in idle state. Mode is only relevant if the appropriate IP module "swakeup" output(s) is (are) implemented
Always read as 0
Always read as 0
Word Interrupt Status Read indicates raw status 0 = inactive 1 = active Writing 1 will set status Writing 0 has no effect
Frame Interrupt Status Read indicates raw status 0 = inactive 1 = active Writing 1 will set status Writing 0 has no effect
Always read as 0
Word Interrupt Enabled Status Read indicates enabled status 0 = inactive 1 = active Writing 1 will clear interrupt Writing 0 has no effect
Frame Interrupt Enabled Status Read indicates enabled status 0 = inactive 1 = active Writing 1 will clear interrupt Writing 0 has no effect
Always read as 0
Word Interrupt Enable/Set Read indicates interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled Writing 1 will set interrupt enabled Writing 0 has no effect
Frame Interrupt Enable/Set Read indicates interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled Writing 1 will set interrupt enabled Writing 0 has no effect
Always read as 0
Word Interrupt Enable/Clear Read indicates interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled Writing 1 will clear interrupt enabled Writing 0 has no effect
Frame Interrupt Enable/Clear Read indicates interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled Writing 1 will clear interrupt enabled Writing 0 has no effect
Number associated with the ipgenericirq for intr output. There are 1 interrupt outputs Write 0x0 : Write to intr IP Generic Any other write value is ignored.
Clock Enable. 0- Data clock is turned off 1- Data clock is enabled
Always read as 0
Serial data clock divide by ratio
Always read as 0

Data delay for chip select 3 00- Data is output on the same cycle as the CS_N goes active 01- Data is output 1 DCLK cycle after the CS_N goes active 10- Data is output 2 DCLK cycles after the CS_N goes active 11- Data is output 3 DCLK cycles after the CS_N goes active

Clock phase for chip select 3 If CKP0 = 0 0- Data shifted out on falling edge; input on rising edge 1- Data shifted out on rising edge; input on falling edge If CKP0 = 1 1- Data shifted out on falling edge; input on rising edge 0- Data shifted out on rising edge; input on falling edge
Chip select polarity for chip select 3 0- Active low 1- Active high
Clock polarity for chip select 3 0- When data is not being transferred, SCK = 0 1- When data is not being transferred, SCK = 1
Always read as 0

Data delay for chip select 2 00- Data is output on the same cycle as the CS_N goes active 01- Data is output 1 DCLK cycle after the CS_N goes active 10- Data is output 2 DCLK cycles after the CS_N goes active 11- Data is output 3 DCLK cycles after the CS_N goes active

Clock phase for chip select 2. If CKP0 = 0 0- Data shifted out on falling edge; input on rising edge 1- Data shifted out on rising edge; input on falling edge If CKP0 = 1 1- Data shifted out on falling edge; input on rising edge 0- Data shifted out on rising edge; input on falling edge
Chip select polarity for chip select 2 0- Active low 1- Active high
Clock polarity for chip select 2 0- When data is not being transferred, SCK = 0 1- When data is not being transferred, SCK = 1
Always read as 0

Data delay for chip select 1 00- Data is output on the same cycle as the CS_N goes active 01- Data is output 1 DCLK cycle after the CS_N goes active 10- Data is output 2 DCLK cycles after the CS_N goes active 11- Data is output 3 DCLK cycles after the CS_N goes active

Clock phase for chip select 1. If CKP0 = 0 0- Data shifted out on falling edge; input on rising edge 1- Data shifted out on rising edge; input on falling edge If CKP0 = 1 1- Data shifted out on falling edge; input on rising edge 0- Data shifted out on rising edge; input on falling edge
Chip select polarity for chip select 1 0- Active low 1- Active high
Clock polarity for chip select 1 0- When data is not being transferred, SCK = 0 1- When data is not being transferred, SCK = 1
Always read as 0

Data delay for chip select 0 00- Data is output on the same cycle as the CS_N goes active 01- Data is output 1 DCLK cycle after the CS_N goes active 10- Data is output 2 DCLK cycles after the CS_N goes active 11- Data is output 3 DCLK cycles after the CS_N goes active

Clock phase for chip select 0. If CKP0 = 0 0- Data shifted out on falling edge; input on rising edge 1- Data shifted out on rising edge; input on falling edge If CKP0 = 1 1- Data shifted out on falling edge; input on rising edge 0- Data shifted out on rising edge; input on falling edge
Chip select polarity for chip select 0 0- Active low 1- Active high
Clock polarity for chip select 0 0- When data is not being transferred, SCK = 0 1- When data is not being transferred, SCK = 1
Always read as 0
Device select. Sets the active chip select for the transfer 00- Chip Select 0 active 01- Chip Select 1 active 10- Chip Select 2 active 11- Chip Select 3 active
Always read as 0
Word length. Sets the size of the individual transfers from 1 – 128 bits 0- 1 bit 1- 2 bits … 127 – 128 bits
Transfer command 000- Reserved 001- 4 pin Read Single 010- 4 pin Write Single 011- 4 pin Read Dual 100 – Reserved 101 – 3 pin Read Single 110 – 3 pin Write Single 111 – 6 pin Read Quad
Frame count interrupt enable
Word count interrupt enable
Always read as 0
Frame Length 0- 1 word 1- 2 words … 4095 – 4096 words
Always read as 0
Word count. This field will reflect the 1-4096 words transferred
Always read as 0
Frame complete. This bit is set after all of the requested words have been transmitted. 0- Transfer is not complete 1- Transfer is complete This bit is reset when the SPI Status Register is read
Word complete. This bit is set after each word transfer is completed. 0- Word transfer is not complete 1- Word transfer is complete This bit is reset when the SPI Status Register is read
Busy bit. Active transfer in progress. This bit is only set during an active word transfer. Between words, the bit will clear to signal that it is ok to read/write the data registers. 0- Idle 1- Busy
Data register for read and write operations
Always read as 0
Number of dummy bits to use if NUM_D_BYTES = 0
Write Command
Always read as 0

Determines if the read command is a single, dual or quad read mode command 00 – Normal read (all data input on spi_din) 01 – Dual read (odd bytes input on spi_din; even on spi_dout) 10 – Normal read (all data input on spi_din) 11 – Quad read (uses spi_qdin0/1)
Number of dummy bytes to be used for fast read. 0 = use the value in NUM_D_BITS 1 = use 8 bits; 2 = use 16 bits; 3 = use 24 bits
Number of address bytes to be sent. 0 = 1 byte; 1 = 2 bytes; 2 = 3 bytes; 3 = 4 bytes
Read Command

Memory Mapped mode interrupt enable. 0 – Interrupts are disabled during memory mapped operations 1 – Word Count interrupt is enabled for memory mapped operations
MMPT select. If 0 (default) config port has is selected to control config of core SPI module. If 1, Memory Mapped Protocol Translator is selected to control config port of core SPI module.
